header.title: Blonde Woman Sucks at Driving - CAR and DRIVER
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Kimberly is a distracted driver who recently hit a deliveryman on a bicycle while she was multitasking. Comedian Nick Stevens and the Driver Rehab team will try to teach her how to keep her eyes on the road and her hands on the wheel, but can they fix Kimberly's bad habits in a day? New episodes every Monday starting September 3rd.  Subscribe! http://bit.ly/subscribecaranddriver. Connect To Nick Stevens: Twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/AhoyNickStevens Tumblr: http://ahoynickstevens.tumblr.com/. Connect To Car and Driver: Twitter: http://bit.ly/tweetcaranddriver. Facebook: http://on.fb.me/facebookcaranddriver. Terrible driving: It's an affliction so common, even some of your closest friends or family members probably suffer. But you can make a difference in the life of a bad driver by sending in video evidence of their driving disasters. If they're selected as candidates for rehabilitation, host Nick Stevens sets an ambush before turning them over to professional driving instructors. The instructors then work to transform them into  world-class-or at least decent-drivers  before we administer an advanced driving test. Pass or fail-there is no other option. Know a terrible driver? Send them to rehab: We'll ambush'em, get them coached up, and give them a final exam. Each week, the Car and Driver YouTube Channel will launch episodes of The Full Hoon, Driver Rehab, Battle of the Beaters, Car and Driver: Tested, Popular Mechanics Saturday Mechanic, and Road & Track Presents.

Just a couple of comments on this show.

Lots of very good advice!  

Several episodes have mentioned pedestrians ALWAYS have the right of way.  Shame on you for perpetuating this myth.  Not true according to NYS law!  Peds have the right of way at crosswalks in uncontrolled intersections.  The rest of the time they are required to obey the signals just like any other traffic.  Another point ... 150 pound pedestrian composed of flesh and bone vs 1 ton of metal and plastic ... who wins this fight?  Let's get back to the basics ... "cross on the green and not in between!"  if you don't understand the reference, ask your parents.

PLEASE come to Ithaca, NY!  My daily commute takes me through the heart of the city.  Wall to wall nominees.
